intro: Popowia sororia, commonly known as the white popowia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture. Popowia sororia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
